body.p: We the undersigned citizens of caldwell county and state of Kentucky, say that we are and have ben acquainted with William. J. Wadlington from his infancy and have long lived in the immediate neighborhood of his father T. B. Wadlington, with whom Williams has lived -- And from his moral and upright character. we believe that said William is entitled to full credit, and his oath is entitled to the fullest of credit. We state that from our intimate acquaintance with said William from his infancy we believe him to be a young man of sobriety, honest and industrious habits, and we believe him to be a youth of sterling integrity

B. J. Mason
Ennis. Hooper
E B Hooper
A. G. Scott
Eli. Nichols.
W. D. Lear
James Miller
Mark Scott
Richard Hunter
J. M. Ervin
R P Dawson
G. B. Glass
D L Hunter
B, N, Dawson
N, Jones
The above Subscribed Names was named sworn to the above named affidavit before me Aug the 16th 1862
T. A. Lowey, J. P. C. C.

I Edmund P. Watkins Clerk of the Caldwell Circuit Court do hereby Certify that I have the Signatures attached to the within affidavit and Know that the Signers to said affidavit are men of good moral character and entitled to full faith and Credit on oath or otherwise

Given under my hand August 19th 1862
E. P Watkins Clk.
Caldwell Circuit Court
